website_summaries.verdict: This durable plastic kickboard is best for larger children and adults. It's hard plastic, so it's better for exercise than play.
pros: Two sets of integrated handles for optional body positioning
Choice of small or large size
More durable and buoyant than a foam board
cons: Made of hard plastic, so if someone gets hit with the board, it will hurt

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids with low tone (autism)
customer_reviews.text: My kid has autism and it causes him to have low tone and motor planning issues. He has taken private lessons to learn how to swim for the past couple of summer. He's 9 now and still can't kick fast enough to stay afloat or move forward. Regular kickboards are a little hard for him to grip for long periods of time. Anyway, look at him go, this is such a great board! He's able to grip it in 3 different ways and he has been practicing daily with it. His kicks are getting so much faster and stronger in just one week! For reference, he is almost 56" and weighs about 68lbs, the small is perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: MLK77

customer_reviews.title: Like the polyethylene feel
customer_reviews.text: I got to try this same board at our local swim pool. I liked it so much, I bought my own. I swim laps & just need a kickboard to put my hands on to keep my balance. I like this one because it's shorter (16.25") (& is noted somewhere it's for kids) & it's easy to keep clean. There is a choice for a longer board (21.xx") for adults. Both are reasonably priced. Yes, if you think this should go under your stomach & hold you afloat, it won't. It's not made for that. It's made to help lap swimmers for kicking. Very happy with it vs the longer hard foam kickboards.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Barnum

customer_reviews.title: Great kickboard for small child
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 5 year old when we got a small pool. At first she found it challenging and I thought it didn't have enough buoyancy because it wouldn't float when she put her weight on it. Turns out that it's designed to be used as an aid, forcing the user to fully extend their bodies and hang off of it while kicking. She got the hang of it and it really helped her get into the correct position for swimming. A day later she learned to swim underwater without the board. The multiple handles allows the board to be used in different body positions. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Neo2000x

customer_reviews.title: Love the handles.
customer_reviews.text: I teach private swimming lessons at people's homes and I love this kickboard because little hands are able to hold onto the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to use. Does not hold you up at all. If you don't really use your body you will drown. I know that it's for "life saving" however when using as a teaching tool, doesn't make the swimmer feel safe at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly E. Apa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t flake, desinigrate, or crack
customer_reviews.text: Ok, the solution to broken foam boards has arrived! Man, my kids broke several of those “High Density Super Sturdy Kickboards”. They always end up using them as surf boards in the pool, not kickboards so they all broke, or the foam would flake and desinigrate. I got tired of cleaning up foam messes and bought this board. PROBLEM SOLVED! Even for kick board activities this is effective. It has multiple grip points and floats well.
customer_reviews.author: Madtown

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Used this in Austin pools (Deep Eddy & Barton)....nice size for my body 5’1”.
customer_reviews.author: Wind Sock @ RedTop Landing

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of them. One for a 6 y/o who know how to swim already and one for a 3 y/o who is learning. Works Very well for both. Our oldest uses it to strengthen his legs, while our youngest uses it to get more comfortable in the water (of course, on top of using them to play). Thickness is great, very sturdy and has a lot of places where kids can get a secure grip.
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for my son. The only minus is he still getting used to since he had a very simple kickboard swim trainer. But this is only a little thing
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy little kickboard
customer_reviews.text: Great kickboard for my 5yr old to practice scissor and whip kick with. Already seeing improved technique and strength when swimming unassisted. My 11, 10 & 8yr olds use it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eringolightly

customer_reviews.title: kids love it
customer_reviews.text: my kids absolutely love using their swim boards, they are sturdy, the dog cannot bite/break these ones. the handles are great for any style grip, and can be used when back swimming as well. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Use in swim class for 5 years-still like new!
customer_reviews.text: I am a swim teacher and use this kick board every day. I decided to writer this review when I noticed I bought it FIVE years ago. And it’s still as good as new! This is a great buy if you’re looking for a kick board!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Swim Board!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who is learning to swim. She loves the different handles in the board and feels secure to swim with it. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Leal

customer_reviews.title: hard plastic
customer_reviews.text: was surprised to find out this is hard, hollow plastic and not a foam kick board. I guess I missed that in the description or I would not have ordered it. It still works ok but seems more suited for kids than adults
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Not good size for small kids
customer_reviews.text: Not the good Size for small kids, not easy for them to grab on side holes. Though durable the material it is made compared to foam.
customer_reviews.author: Man G.

customer_reviews.title: Read the description - Made of unbreakable polyethylene !!!! PLASTIC...NOT  foam
customer_reviews.text: Pros. Solid..good finish... Cons For only 8+ kids - Might not be a great product for kids....hard plastic might hurt...
customer_reviews.author: Vijai Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pool device for learning to swim or exercise. Very sturdy design and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Eve

customer_reviews.title: Hollow plastic not safe for kid’s use.
customer_reviews.text: Hollow plastic not durable. Thought this was closed cell foam. Do not buy this, this is not safe as it can fill with water.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: We are loving this. Using this for swim lessons, on the regular.
customer_reviews.author: Channelling Colee

customer_reviews.title: Only for small children
customer_reviews.text: This product is for small children. Even the large size sinks when any weight is applied.
customer_reviews.author: thatswassup

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than the flatter boards
customer_reviews.text: Easy and comfortable to use. The grip makes it easier to hold especially for the younger children.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Durable for all Weight
customer_reviews.text: JUST LIKE IN LIFEGUARD SCHOOL PERFECT FOR MY KIDS! And me to just hang on to 160 pounds!
customer_reviews.author: RosaMaria Monge

customer_reviews.title: Greta product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to teach my 7yo how to swim. We used the whole summer, and the handles make it easier. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect board to focus your workouts. Versatile. Like the compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great for helping my daughter learn to swim
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality kick board great for kids and adults!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: I swim laps at a local pool. I used to use their equipment but its unavailable now. This board is perfect when I'm tired of freestyle and want to mix it up
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect training our daughters to swim ages 3 &5. Our daughter with autism has really taken off with her kicking her legs and staying afloat with this board.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond, OK

customer_reviews.title: Not foam
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting foam. It’s like a hollow plastic 😞
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Fowlkes

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay above water
customer_reviews.text: I like the multiple handles. But when my 2 year old goes to grab on, it fully is under water.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Just ok. Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Not crazy about. We still use it cause we bought it but it's too hard. Would be better if it was softer material.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: It is not heavy. It is solid and works for what it is made for.
customer_reviews.author: Carrera

customer_reviews.title: Epic fail
customer_reviews.text: Product shows being used by an adult in which it was intended for but it is clearly for a child. Was purchasing to use for exercise in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Yaya

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners. Very sturdy. Handles help kids to hold on
customer_reviews.author: Princessa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small kids
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old and 5 year old love this board. It’s the perfect size for small children.
customer_reviews.author: Kim R

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works for the purpose it is supposed to. Takes some getting used to learn swimming with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous for learning
customer_reviews.text: This is AIR FILLED and will flip young swimmers over.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Item is very tiny.
customer_reviews.text: This item may be suitable for infants but no one bigger than 24 inches tall or weighing over 10 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: cauldren

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. It doesn't even work for my skinny 7yr old.
customer_reviews.author: Belle

customer_reviews.title: Pool Aide
customer_reviews.text: Prefect size for working out in the pool. Exactly what we were looking for. My wife and I both use it to workout.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not the best
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this buy because it's a bit small and not very comfortable to grip since it's plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana L.

customer_reviews.title: It looks good but...
customer_reviews.text: It’s useless. Made from plastic. If it hit, make your child injured. If you step on it, you will slip and injured. I broke my new glasses because of this product. Never recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the handles. They really make the difference in comparison to other boards.
customer_reviews.author: Cjp

customer_reviews.title: Hollow plastic not foam
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was a good, solid, foam kick board. It is a hollow plastic board that will easily take on water when submerged for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really helped my youngest daughter build her confidence in the swimming pool. An invaluable aid at a decent price
customer_reviews.author: Keith Wilfort

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Plug leaks but with some epoxy sealer no more leaks!!!Hollow plastic but very buoyant...
customer_reviews.author: greenemac2003

customer_reviews.title: Not very boient.
customer_reviews.text: Not very boient especially for those trying to learn how to swim.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Voller

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Works just as you would expect. My 3 yr old has already began extending her arms. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for our young boys, it's helping them focus on their kicking.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Board
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was more foam based than hard plastic but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Shopbills

customer_reviews.title: Excellent swimmer aid
customer_reviews.text: well built and easy to use for a swimmer aid.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, very comfortable size for children and adult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son uses this in the pool. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: DLPS

customer_reviews.title: Started kickboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted it a little bigger but its ok for now.
customer_reviews.author: brenda perry

customer_reviews.title: Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this board so that my two kids, ages 5 and 7 could practice their kicking technique when I am their swim instructor. I was looking for a board that had the two different handle areas, just like their professional teacher. It works well. The only thing that I don't like, is that it is made of a hard plastic. This is a good buy, and I recommend it, if your child needs to practice their kicks.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic is poor choice for learning to swim
customer_reviews.text: My mistake for not reading the reviews or even registering that the product description read 'unbreakable polyethylene'. I guess I assumed this would be made of the same neoprene or foam as every other kickboard I've ever seen. The idea of this hard plastic knocking my toddler in the head (particularly after it pops out of the water) during lessons is too concerning. Perhaps this would be good for an adult working their legs in the pool?
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's great, small enough not to be in your way and great for getting across the pool.
customer_reviews.author: sdcd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the same as the ones used at our kids swim school.
customer_reviews.author: Silvana Alessandro

customer_reviews.title: I liked that you could hold it in so many positions
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, but it's more for children than adults...I liked that you could hold it in so many positions, BUT, it's just small...
customer_reviews.author: E. A. McDonnell

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Very Small. Not enough support for an adult. Needs to be twice the size....
customer_reviews.author: Chris  W.

customer_reviews.title: I have a torn rotator and can't do breast strokes without being in pain. This board allows me to do laps without hurting my arm.
customer_reviews.text: This Is a really great board for someone who has limited use of their arms for different swim strokes. I strongly recommend this board for beginners as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: this one is OK , but very small I can not float with this one
customer_reviews.author: THANH DO

customer_reviews.title: the ad stated it was good for adults
customer_reviews.text: the ad stated it was good for adults, but it's not. It's too small it doesn't do well while kicking, it doesn't hold you up very well. It's also plastic instead of the usual kickboards I've used at the water aerobics classes and swim lessons. I don't recommend it. I'll sell mine for $5 as it has my name on it (wish I wouldn't have done that before trying it out)
customer_reviews.author: Sue Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with product. By the time we used it the 30 days time period for return had passed. I personally do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Daysi Delgado

product_meta.title: Poolmaster 50509 Trainer Swim Board, SMALL, Neutral
product_meta.description:
The Swim Board Trainer aids in water training by providing buoyancy support. Made of unbreakable material, the swim trainer is designed with integrated handles which allows for optional body positions during use.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since 1958, Poolmaster has been a leading manufacturer of aftermarket pool and spa products with an unwavering commitment to quality, service and reliability. Poolmaster offers products across six different product lines- Backyard and Decor, Inflatables, Floats, Maintenance, Swim and Dive, and Toys and Games. Poolmaster - We Make Water Fun!
feature_bullets: For aid in advanced swim training
Two sets of integrated handles for optional body positioning

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
